question: What is the first stage in writing theses?
how to write cover page
answer: first step: university logo, second step: university name, third step: college name, fourth step: department name, fifth step: course name, sixth step: project title, seventh step: students name and their numbers, eighth step: supervisor name, ninth step: university place and country, tenth step: thesis submission date

question: how to write title
answer: title begins with strong ing verbs like DESINING, DEVELOPING, and avoid MAKING and DOING, write it with upper case letters, must contain target group and place, Highlight it with any highlighting technique like bold, italic and color

question: how to write students names
answer: Students names must be ordered alphabetically and appear before supervisor name

question: how to write date
answer: you should put the data when you submit thesis to your supervisor, you can write the full name of the month or its abbreviation like this 14 March 2024 or 14 Mar. 2024

question: What is the second page in writing theses
what is acknowledgment
answer: The acknowledgment section is an opportunity for the author to recognize and show appreciation for the contributions of others, acknowledging their support and assistance in bringing the thesis to fruition. However, it's important to maintain professionalism and avoid overly personal or informal language in this section.

question: give me an example for acknowledgement page
answer:
We begin by thanking, first and foremost, God Almighty who helped us complete this thesis.
 We also extend our thanks to our family who have been our primary supporter in all circumstances and times.
Special thanks and appreciation go to the head of our department and our project supervisor, Dr. Thaer Sammar, who gave us his experience and guided us,
 and he was the best supervisor and guide.We also thank the distinguished lecturers and faculty members and everyone
 who contributed to us reaching this stage and had a good impact on our path.In the end, we would like to thank the group members for their respect, cooperation, helping each other with kindness, and completing their work efficiently
